places.name: Chit Chat Burger Bar
places.description: Spacious, sleek operation furnishing handcrafted burgers, plus cocktails, wine & shakes.
places.address: Chit Chat Burger Bar, 955 Granville St, Vancouver, BC V6Z 1L3

featured_reviews.review_id:
We came on Sunday after a hard work day.
The service was great, but not the food.
The burgers were extremely dry, despite we asked the patty to be medium rare. It wasn't.
The buns weren't fresh.
There was enormous amount of onions. I love onions in burger but it was WAY TOO MUCH.
I couldn't find pickles in burger. And the salad leaf was soggy.
As a result I didn't even finish my burger.

The fries were extremely salty and I had to shake off the salt.
That's probably the idea of this bar on how to make customers order more drinks.

It's definitely not a place to eat. The food may be ok if you come for a couple drinks.

featured_reviews.review_id: My favorite burger place in Vancouver with generous price. The zucchini hits the spotThe mushrooms are juicy. Their fries also taste great, very big portion. I would recommend to share the fries.
featured_reviews.review_text: My favorite burger place in Vancouver with generous price. The zucchini hits the spotThe mushrooms are juicy. Their fries also taste great, very big portion. I would recommend to share the fries.

featured_reviews.review_id: I loved the atmosphere, great for a late afternoon. Good location and service, affordable prices. The burgers are simple, not very tasty, but the poutine is very good.  I recommend!
featured_reviews.review_text: I loved the atmosphere, great for a late afternoon. Good location and service, affordable prices. The burgers are simple, not very tasty, but the poutine is very good.  I recommend!

featured_reviews.review_id: It was a nice space with young and amiable staff. The pricing was really good! We tried the classic burgers and I even asked for lettuce wrap instead of buns. I definitely recommend it if you want to have an economical experience while being in downtown.
featured_reviews.review_text: It was a nice space with young and amiable staff. The pricing was really good! We tried the classic burgers and I even asked for lettuce wrap instead of buns. I definitely recommend it if you want to have an economical experience while being in downtown.

featured_reviews.review_id:
We walked in here to grab a bite to eat, and were not disappointed with the burgers.
I got the Viva La Grandville and garlic fries. Enjoyed the burger but for fries would recommend the regular fries.
featured_reviews.review_text:
We walked in here to grab a bite to eat, and were not disappointed with the burgers.
I got the Viva La Grandville and garlic fries. Enjoyed the burger but for fries would recommend the regular fries.

featured_reviews.review_id: We ordered garlic fries, we expected something else than what was served. Although description in the menu was all right garlic, parmesan cheese, cilantro/parsley, and feta dip and it was all there in the plate but somehow it didn't feel okay. The fries were too oily and some of them were soggy. We expected melted cheese and herb like how we get in poutine but it was different.  We were not provided with any paper napkins my friend had to go get them from the counter. In the end their electronic payment machine was not working hence we paid cash and we didn't want to give any tip because we were not happy but the waitress deducted it anyway. I felt it was imposed.

I felt it was imposed.

featured_reviews.review_id: Good vibes, the bacon cheese burger for $12.75 is tasty and good value. A lot of burger for the price. Meat is a bit salty though.
featured_reviews.review_text: Good vibes, the bacon cheese burger for $12.75 is tasty and good value. A lot of burger for the price. Meat is a bit salty though.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Hi William. Thank you so much for the lovely comments 
I will ask the kitchen staff to keep an eye on the salt.

featured_reviews.review_id:
3/5 Experience

2.5/5 Food. 6 chicken wings with a bad taste of orange BBQ taste cost me $13.5 The sauce was dumped on the wings not even fully coated.
The burgers were fine, patty was dry and my burger was drenched in mustard. I'm sure if they cooked the patty 30 less seconds and not add as much mustard the burger would have been a solid 8/10.

?/5 Drinks. I ordered a Shirley Temple and it tasted ok but it was so sweet it was like drinking on a melted jolly rancher with 5tbs of sugar. The server asked if I wanted something else I said no and she kept the drink on the bill.

3/5 Service was pretty good overall part from the drink. Wished someone had checked on us to see how the meal was.

5/5 Restaurant facility. The establishment was super nice and had a great atmosphere. This is a place to drink and have a good time, not really to dine in yet.

places.name: Vonns Vancouver Smash Burgers and Cheesesteak | Smash Burgers | Shakes | Cheesesteak | Nashville Fried Chicken
places.description: Laid-back venue offering hearty chicken dishes & burgers in a snug space, plus views of English Bay.

owner.name: Vonns Vancouver Smash Burgers and Cheesesteak | Smash Burgers | Shakes | Cheesesteak | Nashville Fried Chicken (Owner)

places.address: Vonns Vancouver Smash Burgers and Cheesesteak | Smash Burgers | Shakes | Cheesesteak | Nashville Fried Chicken, 1184 Denman St #104, Vancouver, BC V6M 2M9

featured_reviews.review_id: I came across this place when searching for halal options in Vancouver and this place did not disappoint. While it is somewhat small inside the food here was incredible. The sandwiches were very large with a lot of meat on them and the flavors and textures they added made these sandwiched unique in their own way. The fries here were also really good as they were very crisp on the outside and warm and fluffy on the inside. I would definitely recommend anyone that is passing by to come and eat here.
featured_reviews.review_text: I came across this place when searching for halal options in Vancouver and this place did not disappoint. While it is somewhat small inside the food here was incredible. The sandwiches were very large with a lot of meat on them and the flavors and textures they added made these sandwiched unique in their own way. The fries here were also really good as they were very crisp on the outside and warm and fluffy on the inside. I would definitely recommend anyone that is passing by to come and eat here.

featured_reviews.review_id: Exquisite food and service! They greeted us warmly at the entrance and took us to our table promptly. We had the XD burger, steaks, fries, and top gun. The burger buns were homemade as they meticulously explained. The beef patty was VERY DELICIOUS,  and juicy.  the steak was so smooth, and the sauce served along made it a memorable foodie experience. On the other hand, service was 10/10. They listened attentively to our feedback and was constantly making sure that all customers were satisfied with their experience. We thought the food to be a bit expensive when we first glanced at the menu, but we left thinking it was worth every penny. Will definitely go back!
featured_reviews.review_text: Exquisite food and service! They greeted us warmly at the entrance and took us to our table promptly. We had the XD burger, steaks, fries, and top gun. featured_reviews.review_id: Everything we ordered at this place was better than great. The Cheesesteak was out of this world. I will remember the taste for a while. Truffle fries were amazing. Smash Burgers were great. I'd come back here again and Everytime I come back to Vancouver. I highly recommend it.
featured_reviews.review_text: Everything we ordered at this place was better than great. The Cheesesteak was out of this world. I will remember the taste for a while. Truffle fries were amazing. Smash Burgers were great. I'd come back here again and Everytime I come back to Vancouver. I highly recommend it.

featured_reviews.review_id:
The food is 10/10!!! I ordered a regular burger and it was one of the best burgers I have ever had in Vancouver! Staff were so kind and helpful. Make sure to order truffle fries with your food it's so good!
The one and only issue with this place is that their hours are usually from 1-9 so it is very busy most of the times.  We waited around 40 mins to get our food after we ordered. The wait time to get in was around 5-10 minutes as well. Overall it was a good experience and 100% recommended.
featured_reviews.review_text:
The food is 10/10!!! I ordered a regular burger and it was one of the best burgers I have ever had in Vancouver! Staff were so kind and helpful. Make sure to order truffle fries with your food it's so good!

featured_reviews.review_id:
The food here is pretty good & fully Halal but coming from Toronto, it's nothing OVERLY unique in terms of flavour.

That said, the burgers are good & in Vanvouver, theyre the best burgers I've had. Depending on your exposure to halal burger spots, you may or may not have had better burgers. They did play great music the entirety of our meal though!

Would go back again but not in any rush to. Service was nothing special & there's no washroom (only a hand washing station).

featured_reviews.review_id: The best burgers in Vancouver I've tried so far. Be sure to try potatoes with truffle oil it's the best potatoes, hearty. With a tip, the check came out about $60

featured_reviews.review_id: Been trying to dine here for a while as they're always busy and now I know exactly why: the food is AMAZING! They make everything with care and pride and it shows, 100% recommend had the Birria Tacos, Garden Salad and Truffle fries!
featured_reviews.review_text: Been trying to dine here for a while as they're always busy and now I know exactly why: the food is AMAZING! They make everything with care and pride and it shows, 100% recommend had the Birria Tacos, Garden Salad and Truffle fries!

featured_reviews.review_id: We got the two different chicken burgers (Nashville and decked out) and it was a very messy meal. There really was a lot of chicken in the burger so I will be eating those for leftovers the next day. One burger could have been split between two for sure!
featured_reviews.review_text: We got the two different chicken burgers (Nashville and decked out) and it was a very messy meal. There really was a lot of chicken in the burger so I will be eating those for leftovers the next day. One burger could have been split between two for sure!

places.name: Burger Crush
places.address: Burger Crush, 755 Nelson St, Vancouver, BC V6Z 1V3

featured_reviews.review_id: I recently found this place by a friend, and I am so glad. I've been there two times already, and I've been loving it. So happy that they have thought about dietary restrictions. From how good their plant based patty is, it really shows that they cared. My burger had everything I'd like to have on my burger. I really enjoyed the crush fries and tofu nuggets too! Will go back for sure. It'd be lovely if they bring some sour beers too!!
featured_reviews.review_text: I recently found this place by a friend, and I am so glad. I've been there two times already, and I've been loving it. So happy that they have thought about dietary restrictions. From how good their plant based patty is, it really shows that they cared. My burger had everything I'd like to have on my burger. I really enjoyed the crush fries and tofu nuggets too! Will go back for sure. It'd be lovely if they bring some sour beers too!!

featured_reviews.review_id: Very enjoyable burger, reminds me a lot of in n out. Smash patty style with soft brioche bun. Patty and sauce could use more flavour. Also got the crush fries which were quite good and similar to animal style fries. Would recommend.
featured_reviews.review_text: Very enjoyable burger, reminds me a lot of in n out. Smash patty style with soft brioche bun. Patty and sauce could use more flavour. Also got the crush fries which were quite good and similar to animal style fries. Would recommend.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Quality veggie burger joint in downtown! Walking into the restaurant, it's an order and pay before eating like a fast food joint. Very clean inside, ambiance is very comforting and the staff was friendly. The person at the till was super helpful with recommendations and I went with all his recommendations.

What I ordered:
* Veggie style Cheese Burger, Single patty (Recommend) $11.50
* Combo: Fries and a Orange Milkshake (Recommend) $11

This veggie burger hit all the spots for flavour, their in house sauce laying under fresh tasty veggies and the veggie patty was satisfying, slightly crispy but not greasy in a brioche bun. Highly recommend, the burger was super filling so warning the fries were very tasty as well but it was quite a lot! They fresh cut their fries thin like McDonald's but tastes so much better, crispy, thin and not as greasy. To top off my order I wanted to try their milkshakes. Staff had reco the orange milkshake and what a pleasant surprised that turned out to be! Reminds me of a cream soda orange pop but in a creamy milkshake version! Overall everything was super tasty, I'd recommend taking your order to go if you're making it a combo but the burger itself was good enough. I'd come back to try their vegan burger with the vegan bun. A little pricey here but tastes like fresh ingredients and quality ingredients, so worth the $27 bill with tip.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Loved our messy, flavorful burgers and shakes. Skip the crush fries (they look better than they taste) they were a messy side with too much sauteed onion.

I'd recommend one order of fries for two people with a side of the crush sauce to dip. The milkshakes were good. Loved the rootbeer flavor.
featured_reviews.review_text:

I'd recommend one order of fries for two people with a side of the crush sauce to dip. The milkshakes were good. Loved the rootbeer flavor.

featured_reviews.review_id: Don't want to overhype this place but I left perfectly satisfied.  It had everything I look for in a burger - and I really enjoyed their crush sauce.  It was nice to have something familiar done in a way that felt unique.  I'll definitely come again!
featured_reviews.review_text: Don't want to overhype this place but I left perfectly satisfied.  It had everything I look for in a burger - and I really enjoyed their crush sauce.  It was nice to have something familiar done in a way that felt unique.  I'll definitely come again!

featured_reviews.review_id: I like to try new places for burgers, smash burgers are my new fave. Keep hearing of this place. So decided to check it out. Overall a pretty decent burger. I did like the fries. Maybe i should have got a milk shake. Although the burger was decent, it didn't reach a standard such as a in and out or shake Shack! Just saying. But I i did love the fries. Crispy and thinly sliced. Good with your burger.

featured_reviews.review_id: *June 2023* this is us truly a finger licking good mess in and around your mouth. Tried the vegan cheese burger and the beef cheeseburger. I was surprised at just how amazing they both were. The vegan one is easily the best vegan burger in town. The cheesy fries were also really good. Won't be long till I come back again.
featured_reviews.review_text: *June 2023* this is us truly a finger licking good mess in and around your mouth. Tried the vegan cheese burger and the beef cheeseburger. I was surprised at just how amazing they both were. The vegan one is easily the best vegan burger in town. The cheesy fries were also really good. Won't be long till I come back again.

featured_reviews.review_id: Super pricey for something that is just covered in a cheap cheese sauce. The first few bites of the burger and poutine are great, and then the cheese sauce just gets to be too much. For the price I paid, it's not worth it. I would suggest going to Juicy Joe's over Burger Crush.

featured_reviews.review_id:
The old home of The Old American.  Be super awesome if it was still that but at least you can get ultra rad DL chicken burgers and strips and reminisce about the place that used to be here 30 years ago.

I don't know if I ever met Papa Gus

featured_reviews.review_id:
First time here.  The sign outside does not say DownLow. It says The American. It's more bar than anything - the tables are great for large groups.  The food was very good and very messy.  However, the pop was flat.

Our server was very excellent.

featured_reviews.review_id: Loved the burger! Definitely would come for it, but only if I were in the area. Wings were breaded so wasn't my fave. Dark and Stormy was good but didn't taste like one. Good random cocktail though!

featured_reviews.review_id: Had the Oklahoma burger. It was phenomenal.  Side of onion rings ( battered). They were the best I can recall having. Service was exceptional.  All around top notch, my current go to for burgers out.
featured_reviews.review_text: Had the Oklahoma burger. It was phenomenal.  Side of onion rings ( battered). They were the best I can recall having. Service was exceptional.  All around top notch, my current go to for burgers out.

featured_reviews.review_id: Had a burger which are all 2 Patties so ordered just a single patty because I thought 2 Patties would be too filling.  Turns out the burgers are the size of a large cookie so in hindsight could have managed the 2 Patties.  $18 burger was discounted only $3 for the single patty version. Taste was pretty good but didn't think there was value for my bucks.  Won't be back.

places.name: Bin 4 Burger Lounge
places.description: Busy, modern grill offering inventive, locally sourced burgers, handcut fries & draft brews.
places.address: Bin 4 Burger Lounge, 2996 Granville St, Vancouver, BC V6H 3J7

featured_reviews.review_id:
Bin 4 Burger Lounge (2996 Granville St., Vancouver)

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Bin 4 Burger Lounge located on Granville Street in Vancouver, and I must say that it was a delightful experience. This trendy and cozy restaurant specializes in crafting gourmet burgers with a unique twist, and it certainly lived up to its reputation.

First and foremost, the ambiance of Bin 4 Burger Lounge was inviting and contemporary. The interior was tastefully decorated with a combination of rustic and modern elements, creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The seating arrangements were comfortable, and the staff was attentive and friendly, providing prompt service throughout my visit.

Now let's talk about the star of the show--the burgers. Bin 4 Burger Lounge offers an extensive selection of burgers, each with its own distinct flavor profile. From classic beef burgers to inventive vegetarian options, there is something to satisfy every palate. I opted for their signature "Bin 4 Burger," and it did not disappoint. The patty was juicy, perfectly cooked, and seasoned to perfection. The toppings were fresh, and the brioche bun was soft and complemented the burger beautifully. The portion sizes were generous, ensuring that I left feeling completely satisfied.

In addition to their impressive burger menu, Bin 4 Burger Lounge also offers a variety of tasty sides and appetizers. Their truffle Parmesan fries were a standout, with a delightful combination of flavors that elevated the dining experience. The restaurant also boasts a selection of craft beers and cocktails to complement the meal, adding another layer of enjoyment.

While the overall dining experience at Bin 4 Burger Lounge was excellent, there were a few minor areas where improvements could be made. Firstly, the wait times during peak hours can be a bit long, so it's advisable to make a reservation or plan your visit accordingly. Secondly, the pricing is slightly on the higher side, especially when considering the add-ons and sides. However, the quality of the ingredients and the exceptional flavors justify the price to a large extent.

In conclusion, Bin 4 Burger Lounge is a must-visit spot for burger enthusiasts in Vancouver. With its inviting atmosphere, flavorful burgers, and attentive service, it delivers a memorable dining experience. While it may be a bit pricey, the quality and taste of the food make it worth the investment. I will definitely be returning to Bin 4 Burger Lounge for another mouthwatering burger adventure in the future.

Our server was Jessi, and he is very friendly and his service was superb.

featured_reviews.review_id:
We enjoyed our visit here and likely return at some point.
Started with the lettuce wraps which were unique and tasty!
I had the Bin 9 - "Big Spenny"
$22.25
Brant Lake Wagyu, aged orange cheddar, smoked bacon, pickles, Bin 4 burger sauce, shredded lettuce, tomato, and I added blue cheese. I had fries and wild  mushroom gravy on the side. The fries were good except 1/2 of them are about 2 cms long and overcooked. I definitely didn't enjoy that, but the rest was top-notch.  To the chef, your burger holds together perfectly and isn't at all sloppy! Right up there with my 5 star rated burgers   Thank you!! 
The glutenberg blonde ale went very well with this on a hot day!
Finished with the strawberry / rhubarb cheesecake to go, which was good but very small when you ask for it to go and crammed into a coleslaw sized container.
The service was adequate, could've been a bit more attentive and genuine.
Atmosphere was good, spacious and clean.

Overall, I was happy with my visit here!

Ms Fancy
Google Reviewer
Level 7
6 million + picture views
featured_reviews.review_text:
We enjoyed our visit here and likely return at some point.
Started with the lettuce wraps which were unique and tasty!
I had the Bin 9 - "Big Spenny"
$22.25
Brant Lake Wagyu, aged orange cheddar, smoked bacon, pickles, Bin 4 burger sauce, shredded lettuce, tomato, and I added blue cheese. I had fries and wild  mushroom gravy on the side. The fries were good except 1/2 of them are about 2 cms long and overcooked. I definitely didn't enjoy that, but the rest was top-notch.  To the chef, your burger holds together perfectly and isn't at all sloppy! Right up there with my 5 star rated burgers   Thank you!! 
The glutenberg blonde ale went very well with this on a hot day!
Finished with the strawberry / rhubarb cheesecake to go, which was good but very small when you ask for it to go and crammed into a coleslaw sized container.
The service was adequate, could've been a bit more attentive and genuine.
Atmosphere was good, spacious and clean.

Overall, I was happy with my visit here!

Ms Fancy
Google Reviewer
Level 7
6 million + picture views
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Great tasting burger (Mushroom burger & Big dipper) & friendly staff (Taylor was a great server!) You can choose either fries or salad, but I preferred salad over fries.

A bit difficult to find parking, even paid ones.

featured_reviews.review_id:
My friend told me about Bin 4 Burger Lounge a while back but I didn't get the chance to go until today.
The service and cocktails are great. The burger I ordered was amazing. I love how it looked exactly how it did in the picture. It was also a huge burger that I was able to eat only half of it and had to take the rest home. I ordered the Lob It To Me Burger which had lobster, goat cheese and truffle aioli. It was delicious.
I'm definitely bringing my family here next time.

Zero alcohol drinks tasted great too

featured_reviews.review_id: I tried the Bison Burner burger, and it was absolutely delicious. The burger was juicy, full of flavor, and accompanied by a sweet and spicy jalapeno salsa/jam. However, the fries were not crispy and were a bit too soft and soggy for my taste. They offer a variety of burgers made from chicken, vegan, beef, fish, and bison, with numerous flavors to choose from, and the overall quality of the food was excellent. The seating was comfortable, making it a great place to hang out. They offer a fantastic late-night special after 9 pm, where you can order any burger with fries or salad for only $11, along with a non-alcoholic drink. Excellent servive by the servers.

A small patio outdoor is available.

featured_reviews.review_id: A new find.  The burgers were very outstanding for me.  I have tried a few burger places and this one is one tops it off for me.  A little pricey, but well worth it.   Service was great!  Atmosphere was a little loud for me, but overall good place to try again.

places.name: Hundy
places.address: Hundy, 1144 Homer St, Vancouver, BC V6B 2X6

featured_reviews.review_id:
Burgers were excellent - very nearly a perfect smash burger. Sides were also very good (cabbage salad was a surprise star). Service was quick.

The downside - you order at the counter, get a buzzer to grab your own food, and bus your own table. The minimum tip option is 18%. I don't mind tipping for service but I do resent tipping on zero service to subsidize wages for the business.

Ambiance - there were three different sources of music playing at the same time (the kitchen, the front dining area and then the back bar or the basement?) which was sort of grating.

featured_reviews.review_id: I am not a burger person. That being said this is one of the best burger places out there. This place has been recommended to me by almost all Vancouver natives. Rightly so. Amazing burgers. Best part, they don't force you to buy fries with your burger. Their chicken sandwich burger is one of my favorites. Definitely going back again.

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We are glad you had a great experience!!  See you again soon!!

featured_reviews.review_id:
I loved this place after a long night out! It's a pretty cool space because it also acts as an entrance to a nice bar.

The burgers were fantastic. I wish they had more seatings space but a lot of people were doing takeouts. I recommend the chicken sandwich and the cheeseburger.

featured_reviews.review_id: Open until very late! Went around 1215AM and didn't expect anything amazing as there was no customers there, and only one person was working. The food took a while to come out but the chicken sandwich and burger was so juicy and delicious! Sauce is super good too. Little overpriced, $4 for can of pop, but was worth it. There is a bar downstairs and you can hear and feel the vibration of the music when you are eating. It was quite loud.

featured_reviews.review_id:
It's a pretty good burger.  Sort of reminiscent of Five Guys.  I'd honestly give it a four if it was a bit cheaper.

Bun was soft and fresh.  Meat had good flavor.  Bacon was a little thin.  Patty was a little small.

Fries were good.

As a hang out spot, the back room was poppin', but I had a toddler, so I couldn't eat there.

Worth a shot!

featured_reviews.review_id:
The first time my boyfriend and I came here was July 31 (after someone came up to us in the park and gave us a coupon) and we've been hooked ever since!! The burgers are fresh, delicious, and the fries are always crispy and good.

The atmosphere is super aesthetic ~ I do wish that there was more seating in the Hundy area (instead of a giant yellow pole) without having to go into the speakeasy "The Stockroom". But this isn't that big of an issue as the burgers stay fresh when you take them to go as well!

Very yum!!

featured_reviews.review_id: I have been to Hundy a couple times now. My first experience wasn't great, but I really enjoyed the second. The cheese burger is superior to the bacon cheese burger. I also prefer their cabbage salad to fries. The chicken burger is nice - great size, crust and flavour. I am curious about their hot chicken sandwich and will likely try that if I return.

places.name: Wakwak Burger
places.description: Beef burgers with standard & Japanese variations, served with fries & soft drinks through a window.
places.address: Wakwak Burger, 511 Granville St, Vancouver, BC V6C 1X6

featured_reviews.review_id:
Food:
Overall, it was delicious Japanese burgers. They are smaller than the average Western burger. Really delicious, unique, and fresh burgers. Juicy patties with lots of filling, between two soft buns. The corn dog, on the other hand, is a bit disappointing. It's not as tasty as the burgers.

Favourite dish(es): Chicken Cutlet, Teriyaki Burger

Service:
Usually, one person is behind the counter. Great customer service.

Other Comments:
Check out the "Street Food Vancouver" app for their locations and hours.

Recommend: Definitely a yes!

featured_reviews.review_id: First time trying Wak Wak Burger after seeing it parked in my neighbourhood for many months. It was delicious! We had the Pork Tonkatsu burger and the Japanese Chicken Cutlet burger. Both were very good and enormous! The pork was bigger than the bun and the sauces were a perfect balance. Generous portion of cabbage made it feel like I got my daily requirement of veggies. Can't wait to try other menu items!

featured_reviews.review_id:
4 people, zero online orders but the lady cooking and chewing bacon is a nice touch. Super appreciated the attitude picking up an order with the classic eyeroll too. The guys at the table near me are being served single burgers at a time, have these people ever worked a restaurant or are they having a bad night and spiting their guests.

Lady with the ponytail should probably also wear a hair net or a hat, I probably won't be back but I'm very questionable of how this is being upheld.

Super weird a restaurant that specializes in making burgers that this one particular person seems to be struggling making a few burgers(2, along with some burgers sitting on the side probably out of spite) they've been sitting there for the past 20 minutes.

featured_reviews.review_id: Excellent burger im from Montreal and next time I come back to this area, I will definitely come back. Thank you Vera
featured_reviews.review_text: Excellent burger im from Montreal and next time I come back to this area, I will definitely come back. Thank you Vera

featured_reviews.review_id:
We were looking for a place to eat our first night visiting Vancouver and decided to try Vera's since it was close to our hotel. Unfortunately, the experience was largely disappointing.

+ Good service. We were promptly greeted by the two ladies working there. They were friendly and both checked in during our meal to ask how things were.
+ Portion sizes were reasonable.

- Pricey: We ordered the G-Money burger, Cajun burger, a side of fries and a Coke, which came to $42. The G-Money burger was also $17 in-store despite being listed online for $13.
- Lack of seasoning: The burgers and fries were both very bland because they had absolutely no seasoning. The flavour of the beef and fries could greatly benefit from a little salt and pepper.
- The cut and texture of the fries were not the most appealing. Also, the fries in our basket were a mix of piping hot and cold.
- We noticed a lot of gnats flying around while we were eating, which often makes you question cleanliness behind the scenes.

I am not a local, but if I was, I would not be back a second time.
featured_reviews.review_text:
We were looking for a place to eat our first night visiting Vancouver and decided to try Vera's since it was close to our hotel. Unfortunately, the experience was largely disappointing.

+ Good service. We were promptly greeted by the two ladies working there. They were friendly and both checked in during our meal to ask how things were.
+ Portion sizes were reasonable.

- Pricey: We ordered the G-Money burger, Cajun burger, a side of fries and a Coke, which came to $42. The G-Money burger was also $17 in-store despite being listed online for $13.
- Lack of seasoning: The burgers and fries were both very bland because they had absolutely no seasoning. The flavour of the beef and fries could greatly benefit from a little salt and pepper.
- The cut and texture of the fries were not the most appealing. Also, the fries in our basket were a mix of piping hot and cold.
- We noticed a lot of gnats flying around while we were eating, which often makes you question cleanliness behind the scenes.

I am not a local, but if I was, I would not be back a second time.

Even though they were busy with takeout and deliveries one of the Attendant came to check on us if was everything good. I could also notice that their effort keeping the place clean, doing deep cleaning.

places.name: Five Guys
places.description: Fast-food chain with made-to-order burgers, fries & hot dogs, plus free peanuts while you wait.
places.address: Five Guys, 635 Robson St, Vancouver, BC V6B 5J3

featured_reviews.review_id: Love Five Guys as they always have the best fries in town. absolutely crunchy outside and soft inside, just the right amount. You can customize your burger, and they never mess it up, plus the great fries. They are just a fav go-to place for a quick burger and fries. The fact that they give you free peanuts in shell and have their potato bags all around the store with the peanut oil which they fry it in just creates an awesome environment. Love the open kitchen and the fact that you can see the fries are cut right there, with skin in different shapes. Just so much better than many fast food chains. I just wish they were open longer hours and had more locations.
featured_reviews.review_text: Love Five Guys as they always have the best fries in town. absolutely crunchy outside and soft inside, just the right amount. You can customize your burger, and they never mess it up, plus the great fries. They are just a fav go-to place for a quick burger and fries. The fact that they give you free peanuts in shell and have their potato bags all around the store with the peanut oil which they fry it in just creates an awesome environment. Love the open kitchen and the fact that you can see the fries are cut right there, with skin in different shapes. Just so much better than many fast food chains. I just wish they were open longer hours and had more locations.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Five Guys is a burger paradise in the heart of Vancouver. What sets this joint apart is the fantastic ability to customize your burger just the way you like it. The sheer range of toppings and sauces available ensures that every burger is a unique and personalized experience. The staff's friendly and accommodating nature makes the customization process a breeze.

The burgers themselves are absolute showstoppers. Juicy, flavorful, and made to perfection, these burgers are a testament to the quality of ingredients used. The melt-in-your-mouth experience is unmatched, and it's evident that a lot of care goes into preparing each burger.

Now, let's talk about the fries - they're more than just a side dish, they're an experience on their own. Crispy on the outside and perfectly tender on the inside, these fries are simply addictive. The fact that they're hand-cut and made fresh right there adds an extra level of deliciousness.

The ambiance is lively and inviting, adding to the overall enjoyment of the meal. Whether you're a solo diner or with a group of friends, the welcoming atmosphere makes every visit enjoyable.

For a truly customizable and mouthwatering burger experience paired with some of the best fries around, Five Guys in Vancouver is the place to be. The quality, flavor, and the ability to make your burger your own truly sets it apart. A must-visit for burger enthusiasts.

featured_reviews.review_id: The burgers were good but we found that there isn't much of a difference between the regular and little cheeseburger (little still is a lot). I also liked that there are roasted nuts available for free on the side of the pick-up area.
featured_reviews.review_text: The burgers were good but we found that there isn't much of a difference between the regular and little cheeseburger (little still is a lot). I also liked that there are roasted nuts available for free on the side of the pick-up area.

featured_reviews.review_id: Come for the burgers but not the fries! Even though they give you a good amount of fries it ain't worth it!! The burgers though are great. The tables were all pretty much dirty so expect to clean it off yourself.
featured_reviews.review_text: Come for the burgers but not the fries! Even though they give you a good amount of fries it ain't worth it!! The burgers though are great. The tables were all pretty much dirty so expect to clean it off yourself.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Went here before a concert and there were a lot of customers but finding a table is easy since people just eat and don't really hang around after. Also the tables are quite close together so moving around is quite difficult if the place is full.

The burgers were good but we found that there isn't much of a difference between the regular and little cheeseburger (little still is a lot). I also liked that there are roasted nuts available for free on the side of the pick-up area.

featured_reviews.review_id: Pretty solid burger , juicy, good size and tasty. Love how any extras are included and also the free peanuts. The jalapenos also had a good  to them
featured_reviews.review_text: Pretty solid burger , juicy, good size and tasty. Love how any extras are included and also the free peanuts. The jalapenos also had a good  to them

featured_reviews.review_id: It's expensive of course but you're guaranteed a delicious burger and fries every time so I think that's worth the price. Good char on the crumbley patty and great flavourful cheese. Plenty of seasoning on the fries too coating each and every one.
featured_reviews.review_text: It's expensive of course but you're guaranteed a delicious burger and fries every time so I think that's worth the price. Good char on the crumbley patty and great flavourful cheese. Plenty of seasoning on the fries too coating each and every one.

featured_reviews.review_id: i had a veg Sandwich, which by my standards was pretty ordinary. Lack of taste, maybe there aren't many takers for veg food around here. Though I loved the idea of peanuts, that's something really healthy. The fries were awesome. We had the one with spice and they were worth it.
featured_reviews.review_text: i had a veg Sandwich, which by my standards was pretty ordinary. Lack of taste, maybe there aren't many takers for veg food around here. Though I loved the idea of peanuts, that's something really healthy. The fries were awesome. We had the one with spice and they were worth it.

places.name: Juicy Joe's Burgers
places.address: Juicy Joe's Burgers, 2211 Granville St, Vancouver, BC V6H 3G1

featured_reviews.review_id:
I was searching for the best burger in town and stumble upon juicy joe's on Google map, a 4.9 star rated take out burger place with hundreds of reviews, too good to be true right?

No, they totally lived up to their reviews, from the service all the way to the food they are in every way the best in town.

I've got the truffle mushroom burger recommend by the staff with a half poutine, the burger is rich and flavourful, everything works really well together. Poutine is beautifully done, and their gravy is exceptionally rich.

You just have to try it to believe it.
featured_reviews.review_text:
I was searching for the best burger in town and stumble upon juicy joe's on Google map, a 4.9 star rated take out burger place with hundreds of reviews, too good to be true right?

No, they totally lived up to their reviews, from the service all the way to the food they are in every way the best in town.

You just have to try it to believe it.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Celeste, trust us we aren't out here trying to catfish anyone with our 4.9 stars! That is just the result of hard work, a stellar team and dang good food. In all seriousness, thank you for your support and for taking the time to leave such a kind review. Welcome to the Juicy Joes family

featured_reviews.review_id: Juicy Joe's serves great burgers, its specialty. The beef burgers are grass finished, and 2 smashed patties are on each burger. Currently Joe's serves take-out only so drop by at the Ommeleterie restaurant,  at 6th and Granville, where they serve out of kitchen, order, and the burgers are done in 10 minutes...so quick! Bon appetit!
featured_reviews.review_text: Juicy Joe's serves great burgers, its specialty. The beef burgers are grass finished, and 2 smashed patties are on each burger. Currently Joe's serves take-out only so drop by at the Ommeleterie restaurant,  at 6th and Granville, where they serve out of kitchen, order, and the burgers are done in 10 minutes...so quick! Bon appetit!
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hey Janet, good food and even better customer service is our specialty! We are so happy to hear you liked the food and can't wait to feed you again soon

featured_reviews.review_id:
Probably one of the better if not best smash burgers in vanc.

I had the truffle Swiss burger and the bacon cheeseburger and both were delicious.

The truffle Swiss mushroom burger was my favourite and personally I really loved white spot Monty mushroom burger but this brings it to another level.

Wouldn't hesitate to late night snack again.

Disclaimer.. atmosphere was my car haha so there's no dine in. But I gave it a 5 since I knew about that coming in.

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hey Felix, we are so happy to welcome you to the world of next-level smash burgers! We can't wait to feed you again soon

featured_reviews.review_id:
WOWOWOW.

Best smash burgers in town!! The seasoning, the crisp, the flavor- delicious.

A little expensive but you get what you pay for!
featured_reviews.review_text:
WOWOWOW.

Best smash burgers in town!! The seasoning, the crisp, the flavor- delicious.

A little expensive but you get what you pay for!
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hey Nathan, we are all about top quality, amazing food and even better customer service. Thanks for supporting our burger dreams

featured_reviews.review_id:
Long story short: definitely give this place a try. Place has 4.9 for a reason!

It was a cold dark rainy night (seriously, sept 24, 8pm, it was raining). My partner and I were standing outside the omelettery, puzzled by the burger sign, as we tried to open up the qr code menu on our phones.

The owner, Sina, flung open the front door and welcomed us to look at the menu inside. He then took us on a journey on how his burger ingredients were sourced, prepared and served. All of which, was brimming with excitement and passion. You could really tell Sina was really proud of what he and his team were slinging. His pitch made us forget we were walking over from having dessert.

We had to try one, even though we were full.

We got the juicy original burger, and we enjoyed it next to our car, under the lights of a carpet store. So I can't say for sure how well it holds up for delivery or long transport.

The beef: smash-seared perfectly. Not too thin that you get jerky. Smashed enough so you get a crisp meaty crust but the center is still juicy.

The bun: airy, light, not soggy or falling aparty.

The caramelized onions: slowly cooked to a perfect unrushed jammy perfection.

Will definitely be back to try the other more hefty burgers!

featured_reviews.review_id: *Inside Paul's Omelettery* This smashburger is absolutely insane - 10/10 and even better that it's Grass Fed, Grass Finished, and never frozen so the flavor is incredible. We're visiting from SF on our way to Whistler and saw the high rating on Google. The people there could not be more lovely and I can't recommend enough. I got the lettuce wrapped cheeseburger with carmelized onions (carmelized for 12-24 hours) with bacon and it was perfection. They're open from 5pm-1am and it's pick-up or delivery only. We will be returning on our way back from Whistler!
featured_reviews.review_text: *Inside Paul's Omelettery* This smashburger is absolutely insane - 10/10 and even better that it's Grass Fed, Grass Finished, and never frozen so the flavor is incredible. We're visiting from SF on our way to Whistler and saw the high rating on Google. The people there could not be more lovely and I can't recommend enough. I got the lettuce wrapped cheeseburger with carmelized onions (carmelized for 12-24 hours) with bacon and it was perfection. They're open from 5pm-1am and it's pick-up or delivery only. We will be returning on our way back from Whistler!
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hey Caitlin, we have been called the burger speak easy because we have a ghost kitchen inside another restaurant. You have the team blushing with such a kind review. We can't wait to feed you on your way back from Whistler

featured_reviews.review_id: Very high chance this place has the best burger in Vancouver...bacon cheeseburger was extremely flavourful...only downside is that it's takeout only. My understanding is that they will open a sit-down in the near future. A must try!
featured_reviews.review_text: Very high chance this place has the best burger in Vancouver...bacon cheeseburger was extremely flavourful...only downside is that it's takeout only. My understanding is that they will open a sit-down in the near future. A must try!
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Tomas, we are just out here smashing burgers and your expectations! In all seriousness, your support means the world to us. It's true! We have been dreaming of a sit down location for quite some time now so, who knows what will happen.

featured_reviews.review_id: The reviews don't lie. Run, don't walk to grab yourself a burger! Service was exceptional. The three of us got a free cookie each! :)
featured_reviews.review_text: The reviews don't lie. Run, don't walk to grab yourself a burger! Service was exceptional. The three of us got a free cookie each! :)
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Krystyn, we are so happy to hear that we have another happy Juicy Joe's Family member! We can't wait to feed you again soon
